FuncDef:
The save attack-source-trace linktype command saves information about attack source tracing saved in the memory as a file.
By default, the information about attack source tracing saved in the memory of an interface board does not save as a file.
CLIs: save attack-source-trace slot { <slot-id> | all } [ file <filename> ] linktype { ethernet | ppp | hdlc }

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of the file for saving information about attack source tracing.
The value is a string of 1 to 128 characters.

Specifies the link layer protocol is HDLC protocol.
-

Specifies the slot ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 1 to 31.

Examples: <HUAWEI> save attack-source-trace slot 1 file aaa linktype ethernet
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
linktype indicates that the system saves packets by link layer type. For example, if the PPP parameter is used, the system saves the packets encapsulated with PPP or with the link layer protocol being PPP.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
